TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:

> Were you more active on the forums before or after becoming a mod?
> 

I was likely more active on the forums before becoming a moderator.  Now I have a tendency to quietly browse the forum, less likely to post than before.  But I do still comment on posts that I feel I have something worth contributing.
What is the most discussed topic on this forum?
Metallic Hydrogen, The barn, EULA and redshell, KSP2 myths, and an airplane on a treadmill.

I want to know what counts as rping because I see a lot of agencies and I kinda want to start my own but to me it sounds like rping?

Edit: please respond I'm trying not to break rules

**Edited <time datetime="2022-10-20T23:49:23Z" title="10/20/2022 11:49  PM" data-short="1 yr">October 20, 2022</time> by yeetythethird2020**
  
I need answers!!!!!

Roleplaying is just that, roleplaying.   Players take on roles within a group or groups, and act out scenarios.   It becomes a problem when arguments arise and it spills out into the forums.   It got bad enough in the past that we had to just outlaw it completely. 

Now, There are "agencies" within mods, but that's not role playing, that's just a modder giving a name to a "publisher".

Okay I think I understand stand it now and I'm deeply sorry about posting this twice I had completely forgot I had posted this here and reposted it in that other area anyways thank you!

Edit: now I can start my own agency since it's not against the rules!

**Edited <time datetime="2022-10-21T00:14:05Z" title="10/21/2022 12:14  AM" data-short="1 yr">October 21, 2022</time> by yeetythethird2020**

Where does one find the rules for cinematics?

Im looking to making one with real countries, in the stock kerbal system, on an alternate timeline....

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, Superluminal Gremlin said:
> 
> 
> Where does one find the rules for cinematics?
> 

As long as they conform to the rest of the forum rules, it should be fine.   We would consider a cinematic to be scripted, and while any voice actors you have would be technically playing a role, that's not quite the same.
I dont intend on having voice actors

> An airplane that runs on metallic hydrogen on a treadmill in a red shell barn covered by the EULA

Reading about KSP 2 myths as well

Roleplaying became a problem when players started to feud over rivalries between their made-up countries and rocket businesses. It got way too serious and we ended up having to ban some people over the arguments. So you can make up a pretend company and write up your mission reports and fiction as if it was real, but we do not allow people to "hire" others or fight "wars" and that kind of thing.

Ok ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

My situation is more of 2 real rocket companies from real countries in kinda like a second space race...
Just be careful it doesn't become political ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
